Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please could I request, under the Freedom of Information Act, the following information:
1. How many multi-use games areas (MUGAs) available for public use were there in your local authority area during the financial year:
a.	2019/20
b.	2022/23
2. How many netball courts available for public use were there in your local authority area during the financial year:
a.	2019/20
b.	2022/23
3. How much financial support (grants/funding) was given to netball clubs during the financial year 2022/23.
With best wishes,
Thomas Hambledon

Dear Thomas Hambledon,
Thank you for your request for information relating to sports provision
which we received on 22/09/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 20/10/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Thomas Hambledon,
Thank you for your request for information relating to sports provision
which we received on 22/09/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
The actual number of MUGAs is not easy to clearly provide. We have a whole
range of ball game facilities that can be considered to be MUGAs, so we
have provided a range numbers dependent on the type of ‘multi-ball game’
facility.
Number of MUGAs 22/23 = 45, in 2019/20 there were = 44.
These figures don’t include single use courts: tennis courts, basketball
courts, kickabout football courts, kickwalls etc. it also does not include
MUGAs in the grounds of schools and leisure centres.
Sites that we record with all kinds of Multi-use games facilities include
(including basketball facilities as these courts are used for multi-game
activities) = 62
There are 3 courts marked out for both Netball and Basketball (Meersbrook,
Bingham and High Hazels) (22/23). In 19/22 there would have been 1.
Sheffield City Council’s Sports and Leisure Team do not have funding to
provide direct funding to clubs – which would include netball clubs.
Netball facility improvements at sites such as High Hazels Park and
Bingham park have been delivered through external funding.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an

be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
